required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Bioequivalence Study of ASC-01 Placebo (Aripiprazole 0 mg/Sertraline 100 mg) and Sertraline Tablet in Healthy Male Subjects

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the bioequivalence of ASC-01 Placebo and sertraline Tablet in Japanese healthy male subjects.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Bioequivalence of ASC-01 placebo and sertraline tablet by assessment of Cmax and Area Under Curve (AUC)

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC(0-inf), MRT(0-inf), Tmax, Î»z, AUC_%Extrap, T half, CL/F, CL/F/BW, Vz/F and Vz/F/BW of sertraline

arm_group.description: A single oral dose of ASC-01 Placebo (sertraline 100 mg)
A single oral dose of sertraline tablets (sertraline 100 mg)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male volunteers aged 20 to 40 years.
- Have a body mass index (BMI) between 18.5 and 25.0 kg/m2 and a weight of at least 50 kg.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any clinically important disease or disorder which, in the opinion of the Investigator, may either put the volunteer at risk because of participation in the study.
- History or presence of gastrointestinal, hepatic, or renal disease or any other condition known to interfere with absorption, distribution, metabolism, or excretion of drugs.
- Any clinically significant abnormalities in the physical examination, clinical laboratory values, 12-lead ECG, or vital signs, as judged by the Investigator.
